conclusion: Identify the unknowns: Tension in AC, CD, DB; Horizontal force F at D; Angle θ ropes AC and BD make with the ceiling.
Write geometry relations: Projections on the ceiling of AC and BD must each be length L cos θ.
Calculate cos θ = ½ and θ = 60° using the relation 2 L cos θ + L = 2 L.
Equilibrium of point C: Vertical forces T_AC sin θ = m g.
Equilibrium of point C: Horizontal forces T_AC cos θ = T_CD.
Equilibrium of point D: Horizontal forces F = T_DB cos θ − T_CD.
Equilibrium of point D: Vertical forces T_DB sin θ = 0, hence T_DB acts purely horizontally through D.
From geometry of joint D: T_DB = T_CD /cos θ, and using T_AC cos θ = T_CD, T_DB = T_AC.
Substitute values: From T_AC sin θ = m g, T_AC = 2m g/√3.
Calculate T_CD = T_AC cos θ = m g/√3.
Using F = T_DB cos θ − T_CD, calculate F = 0.
Minimum applied force: Geometry forces T_DB to supply exactly the horizontal component required to balance T_CD, so no additional force is necessary.
